page.title: 10THE MURE HALL
page.content: Uplawmoor village is fortunate in having a well-appointed village hall which was presented to the village by the Mure family in 1914.The original building was enlarged with funds raised locally and is now the focal point of much village activity. Throughout the year it is home to the Scottish Women's Rural Institute, the pre-school playgroup,a Child Welfare clinic and meetings of the Community,District and Regional Councils. In winter badminton,carpet bowls and bridge are played in it. In addition there are dances, parties,wedding receptions,concerts and exhibitions. In summer it is used by visiting schools or for the church fete.
